Class PersonMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • PersonMethods

  • public class PersonMethods
extends java.lang.Object
    This class groups all methods used to create and modify Person objects.

    This class enables the user to create new Persons - architects, contractor and customers. It also writes any new entries and changes to the database.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Nadia Botha

    • Constructor Detail

      • PersonMethods

        public PersonMethods()

    • Method Detail

      • determineProjectArchitectID

        public static int determineProjectArchitectID(java.util.Scanner userInput)
        This method returns an architect ID based on a name and number.

        The user provides an architect name and number which is then used to obtain the ID of the architect from the architects table. If the name and number provided, cannot be found, a new architect is created an written to the database.

        Parameters:
        userInput - Scanner object to enable the user to provide input.
        Returns:
        returns an integer for the architect's ID in architects table.
        See Also:
        #checkIfArchitectExists(String, String), #getExitingArchitectID(String, String), #nextUniquearchitectID(), #createNewArchitectAndWriteToDatabase(Scanner, int, String, String)

      • createNewArchitectAndWriteToDatabase

        private static void createNewArchitectAndWriteToDatabase(java.util.Scanner userInput,
                                                         int architectID,
                                                         java.lang.String architectNumber,
                                                         java.lang.String architectFullName)
        This method creates a new Person object called projectArchitect and writes the new architect to the architects table.

        The method calls separate methods to create a Person object and to write it to the database.

        Parameters:
        userInput - Scanner object to enable the user to provide input.
        architectID - integer that represents the architect's ID in the architects table.
        architectNumber - String that represents the architect's number in the architects table.
        architectFullName - String that represents the architect's name in the architects table.
        See Also:
        #createNewArchitect(String, String, Scanner), #writeNewArchitectToDatabase(int, String, String, String, String)

      • checkIfArchitectExists

        private static int checkIfArchitectExists(java.lang.String userArchitectFullName,
                                          java.lang.String userArchitectNumber)
        This method takes an architect name and number as input and checks if the architect is in the database.

        If the architect is in the database the integer 1 is returned, otherwise 0 is returned.

        Parameters:
        userArchitectFullName - String that represents the architect's full name.
        userArchitectNumber - String that represents the arhitect's number.
        Returns:
        returns an integer, where 1 represents that the architect is in the system and 0 represents that the architect does not exist.

      • getExitingArchitectID

        public static int getExitingArchitectID(java.lang.String architectName,
                                        java.lang.String architectNumber)
        This method returns the architect ID for an existing architect in the system.

        The method uses an architect name and number to look for the ID in the database.

        Parameters:
        architectName - String that represents the architect's name.
        architectNumber - String the represents the architect's number.
        Returns:
        returns an integer that represents the architect's ID within the database.

      • createNewArchitect

        private static Person createNewArchitect(java.lang.String architectName,
                                         java.lang.String architectNumber,
                                         java.util.Scanner userInput)
        This method creates a new Person project architect.

        It takes the architect name and number as input, additionally requests the email and physical address to create a new Person object. This is used to create a new architect Person object.

        Parameters:
        architectName - String that represents the architect's name.
        architectNumber - String the represents the architect's number
        userInput - Scanner object to enable the user to provide input.
        Returns:
        returns a Person object - architect.
        See Also:
        #Person(String, String, String, String)

      • writeNewArchitectToDatabase

        private static void writeNewArchitectToDatabase(int architectID,
                                                java.lang.String architectName,
                                                java.lang.String architectNumber,
                                                java.lang.String architectEmail,
                                                java.lang.String architectAddress)
        This method writes a new architect record into the architects table.

        The fields for the architect are provided as input to the methods, the database is accessed and an update query is performed to write the new architect to the database.

        Parameters:
        architectID - integer that represents the architect's ID in the architects table.
        architectName - String that represents the architect's name in the architects table.
        architectNumber - String that represents the architect's number in the architects table.
        architectEmail - String that represents the architect's email in the database.
        architectAddress - String that represents the architect's address in the database.

      • nextUniquearchitectID

        private static int nextUniquearchitectID()
        This method loops through the existing architect IDs and returns the integer for the next available unique ID.
        Returns:
        returns the integer for the next available unique architect ID.

      • createArchitectPersonObject

        public static Person createArchitectPersonObject(int architectID)
        This method creates a Person object using the architect ID.

        This method uses an architect ID as input, reads all the field values from the architects table for the ID and creates a new Person object.

        Parameters:
        architectID - integer that represents the architect's ID in the architects table.
        Returns:
        returns a Person object (architect) created from architect ID.
        See Also:
        #Person(String, String, String, String)

      • changeArchitectNumber

        private static void changeArchitectNumber(java.util.Scanner userInput,
                                          int architectID)
        This method enables the user to edit the number of an existing architect.

        The method uses the architect ID to find the record. Requests the user to input the updated number and updates the number for the specific ID.

        Parameters:
        userInput - Scanner object to enable the user to provide input.
        architectID - integer that represents the architect's ID in the architects table.

      • changeArchitectEmail

        private static void changeArchitectEmail(java.util.Scanner userInput,
                                         int architectID)
        This method enables the user to edit the email of an existing architect.

        The method uses the architect ID to find the record. Requests the user to input the updated email and updates the email for the specific ID.

        Parameters:
        userInput - Scanner object to enable the user to provide input.
        architectID - integer that represents the architect's ID in the architects table.

      • changeArchitectAddress

        private static void changeArchitectAddress(java.util.Scanner userInput,
                                           int architectID)
        This method enables the user to edit the physical address of an existing architect.

        The method uses the architect ID to find the record. Requests the user to input the updated address and updates the address for the specific ID.

        Parameters:
        userInput - Scanner object to enable the user to provide input.
        architectID - integer that represents the architect's ID in the architects table.

      • changeArchitectContactDetails

        public static void changeArchitectContactDetails(java.util.Scanner userInput)
        This method enables the user to user to update the contact details of an architect.

        The user chooses if he/she wants to update the architect's number, email or physical address. Depending on which option he/she chooses, the relevant method is called, which requires an architect ID to find and update the record.

        Parameters:
        userInput - Scanner object to enable the user to provide input.
        See Also:
        #displayArchitectSummary(), #checkIDInt(Scanner, String), #checkIfArchitectIDExists(int), #architectDetailsToUpdate(), #changeArchitectNumber(Scanner, int), #changeArchitectEmail(Scanner, int), #changeArchitectAddress(Scanner, int)

      • checkIfArchitectIDExists

        private static int checkIfArchitectIDExists(int userDefinedArchitectID)
        This methods checks if an architect exists in the database using an architect ID.

        The method will return 1 if the architect is found in the database and 0 if not.

        Parameters:
        userDefinedArchitectID - integer value that represents the architect's ID.
        Returns:
        returns an integer value, where anything more than zero indicates that the architect is in the database.

      • determineProjectContractorID

        public static int determineProjectContractorID(java.util.Scanner userInput)
        This method returns a contractor ID based on a name and number.

        The user provides a contractor name and number which is then used to obtain the ID of the contractor from the contractors table. If the name and number provided, cannot be found, a new contractor is created an written to the database.

        Parameters:
        userInput - Scanner object to enable the user to provide input.
        Returns:
        returns an integer for the contractor's ID in contractors table.
        See Also:
        #checkIfContractorExists(String, String), #getExitingContractorID(String, String), #nextUniqueContractorID(), #createNewContractorAndWriteToDatabase(Scanner, int, String, String)

      • createNewContractorAndWriteToDatabase

                                                          int contractorID,
                                                          java.lang.String contractorNumber,
                                                          java.lang.String contractorFullName)
        This method creates a new Person object called projectContractor and writes the new contractor to the contractors table.

        The method calls separate methods to create a Person object and to write it to the database.

        Parameters:

        contractorID - integer that represents the contractor's ID in the contractors table.

      • writeNewContractorToDatabase

        private static void writeNewContractorToDatabase(int contractorID,
                                                 java.lang.String contractorName,
                                                 java.lang.String contractorNumber,
                                                 java.lang.String contractorEmail,
                                                 java.lang.String contractorAddress)
        This method writes a new contractor record into the contractors table.

        The fields for the contractor are provided as input to the methods, the database is accessed and an update query is performed to write the new contractor to the database.

        contractorID - integer that represents the contractor's ID in the contractors table.
        contractorName - String that represents the contractor's name in the contractors table.
        contractorNumber - String that represents the contractor's number in the contractors table.
        contractorEmail - String that represents the contractor's email in the database.
        contractorAddress - String that represents the contractor's address in the database.

        userInput - Scanner object to enable the user to provide input.
        customerID - integer that represents the customer's ID in the architects table.

      • changeCustomerContactDetails

        public static void changeCustomerContactDetails(java.util.Scanner userInput)
        This method enables the user to user to update the contact details of a customer.

        The user chooses if he/she wants to update the customer's number, email or physical address. Depending on which option he/she chooses, the relevant method is called, which requires a customer ID to find and update the record.

        Parameters:
        userInput - Scanner object to enable the user to provide input.
        See Also:
        #displayCustomerSummary(), #checkIDInt(Scanner, String), #checkIfCustomerIDExists(int), #customerDetailsToUpdate(), #changeCustomerNumber(Scanner, int), #changeCustomerEmail(Scanner, int), #changeCustomerAddress(Scanner, int)

      • checkIfCustomerIDExists

        public static int checkIfCustomerIDExists(int userDefinedCustomerID)
        This methods checks if a contractor exists in the database using a customer ID.

        The method will return 1 if the customer is found in the database and 0 if not.

        Parameters:
        userDefinedCustomerID - integer value that represents the customer's ID.
        Returns:
        returns an integer value, where anything more than zero indicates that the customer is in the database.

      • checkIDInt

        public static int checkIDInt(java.util.Scanner userInput,
                             java.lang.String personID)
        This method checks if the string that the user provided can be used as a valid ID integer.

        The method uses parsing to check if the user provided a valid integer. If it is not a valid integer, the user is requested to provide a different input.

        Parameters:
        userInput - Scanner object to enable the user to provide input.
        personID - String that represents the ID of a person (architect, contractor, customer)
        Returns:
        returns the valid integer for the person ID.
